intro: Hypocyrta ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty hypocraterium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and palmate leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, arid environments.
